crazyballrun.game.level

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.level.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    The Statistics class contains (player specific) data of the current level which may be used to check "player reached goal?" or to show some statistical values for each player after finishing the game (e.g. kill/getting-killed ratio). This class might also be used by the AI to determine how close it is to its goal and how an action influences the distance to the goal. Additionally the "Statistics" store the time passed since the level start in miliseconds to allow a time-based game.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Statistics.ValueType
      Defines statistical attributes observed by the game for the final statistic shown after finishing a level.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Goal[] goals,
              java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
        Creates a table for statistical values. The table size depends on the number of players and statistical attributes.
        Parameters:
        goals - player goals (array place = player id)
        players - list of players

      • finished

        public boolean finished()
        Checks if one of the players has reached its goal.
        Returns:
        'true' if the level should end

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes the time-counting for the game-time (time passed since level start). This method has to be called after resuming the game from "pause".

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the game time (time which has passed since beginning of the level).

      • getGameTime

        public long getGameTime()
        Outputs the time passed since level start in ms.
        Returns:
        time passed since level start [miliseconds]

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int player,
              Statistics.ValueType attr)
        Reads a statistical value from the table.
        Parameters:
        player - player id
        attr - statistical attribute type
        Returns:
        value of the attribute with respect to the player number
